entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 12 at 3:39PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Winter Storm Approaching West Coast of Alaska Late Tuesday Through Wednesday... A strong storm moving into the Bering Sea on Tuesday and Wednesday will bring significant snow and possible blizzard conditions to St Lawrence Island and the Yukon Delta Tuesday night, and to the remainder of the West Coast of Alaska on Wednesday and Wednesday

entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON MONDAY TO 6 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills to 60 below expected. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Deltana and Tanana Flats.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 12 at 3:26PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Blowing Snow and Cold Wind Chills In Alaska Range Passes... North winds of 20 to 40 mph, blowing and drifting snow, and wind chills to 50 below are occuring in Windy Pass south of the Denali Park Entrance, and in Isabel Pass south of Trims Camp. Visibility may be less than one half mile at times. These conditions will continue through tonight, then improve

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 12 at 2:21PM PST until December 13 at 10:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Sneaker waves possible. * WHERE...In Washington, South Washington Coast. In Oregon, Central Oregon Coast and North Oregon Coast. * WHEN...Through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Sneaker waves can suddenly knock people off of their

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 12 at 1:56PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE CHEHALIS RIVER IN GRAYS HARBOR AND THURSTON COUNTIES IS EXPECTED TO CREST JUST BELOW FLOOD STAGE TONIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING... The Chehalis River at Grand Mound was cresting this afternoon within about a foot of flood stage. The river was still rising at Porter and is forecast to crest late tonight and Monday morning about 0.4

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 12 at 1:33PM PST until December 13 at 12:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Snow level will generally hold at 1500 to 2000 feet tonight into Monday, with additional snow accumulations 3 to 6 inches. Heavy showers could drop snow levels a bit more at times, with snow possible down to 1000 feet at times tonight, but any accumulations will be an inch or less.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 12 at 1:33PM PST until December 13 at 12:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Snow level will generally hold at 1500 to 2000 feet tonight into Monday, with additional snow accumulations 3 to 8 inches. Heavy showers could drop snow levels a bit more at times, with snow possible down to 1000 feet, with any accumulations up to 2 inches in spots.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 12 at 1:33PM PST until December 14 at 12:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Snow. Snow showers tonight and Monday will bring an additional snow accumulations of 8 to 13 inches. Snow level will hold at 1500 to 2000 feet. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades.

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued December 12 at 7:47PM MST until December 14 at 8:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MST MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Wind gusts 35 to 45 mph remain possible through the overnight hours. For the High Wind Watch starting early Monday morning, southwest winds will increase again up to 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued December 12 at 7:47PM MST until December 14 at 8:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Wind gusts 30 to 40 mph remain possible through Monday. entry.title: High Wind Watch issued December 12 at 7:47PM MST until December 14 at 8:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Wind gusts 30-40 mph remain possible through Monday. For the High Wind Watch, southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible.

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued December 12 at 7:13PM MST until December 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MST MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. Wind gusts on Outer Drive and in the Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range up to 75 mph are possible. * WHERE...Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range and Natrona County

entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 45 to 55 mph with gusts up to 75 mph, or higher possible. * WHERE...Wind River Mountains East. This includes Red Canyon to South Pass.

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued December 12 at 7:13PM MST until December 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...South to southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...East Sweetwater County. This includes Interstate 80 from Rock Springs to Wamsutter.

entry.title: High Wind Watch issued December 12 at 7:13PM MST until December 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible for lower elevations. entry.title: High Wind Watch issued December 12 at 7:13PM MST until December 14 at 11:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...South winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Lander Foothills. * WHEN...From 2 AM MST Tuesday through 11 PM MST Tuesday night.
